name: Lycopus virginicus
Relationship: Compare: EPHEDRA - Teamster's Tea - (in exophthalmic goitre; eyes feel pushed out with TUMULTUOUS action of heart); FUCUS; SPARTEINE; CRATAEGUS. ADRENALIN 6x.

Heart: Precordial pain; constriction, tenderness, pulse, weak, irregular, intermittent, tremulous, rapid
Rheumatoid, flying pains, associated with heart disease
Palpitation from nervous irritation, with oppression around heart
Eyes: Supraorbital pain, with aching in testicles
Protrusion, pressing, outward, with tumultuous action of heart
Respiratory: Cough, with HEMOPTYSIS, bleeding small but frequent
Profuse flow of liquid, watery urine, especially when the heart is most irritable; also scanty urine
Head: Nosebleed
Frontal headache; worse, frontal eminences; often succeeded by labored heart
Sleep: Wakefulness and morbid vigilance with inordinately active, but weak circulation

details: A heart remedy, and of use in exophthalmic goitre and hemorrhoidal bleeding. Indicated in diseases with tumultuous action of the heart and more or less pain. HEMOPTYSIS DUE TO VALVULAR HEART DISEASE. Beneficial in toxic goitre used in the pre-operative stage. Dose, 5 drops of tincture (Beebe).Lowers the blood pressure, reduces the rate of the heart and increases the length of systole to a great degree. Passive hemorrhages. (ADRENALIN 6x.)
